p: Rosmarinic acid (MW 360), a well-known dimer of caffeic acid characteristic from Thymus plants, and its derivatives overall represented about 15% of the total phenolics. This compound was eluted in peak 18, which showed the [M− H] − ion at m/z 359 and the product ions at m/z 161, 179, 197, 223 in MS 2. Also, two other rosmarinic acid derivatives were found in moderate amounts in the extract. These were eluted in peaks 16 and 17, being characterized by [M− H] − ions at m/z 521 and 403, respectively, and the presence of a major product ion at m/z 359.
